title: Govt remains committed to ensuring relief reaches all affected communities without delays – President
byline: The government remains committed to ensuring relief reaches to all affected communities without any financial delays, the President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasized.

title: Showers above 75 mm likely in some places in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces
byline: Several spells of showers have been predicted for the Northern, North-Central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in the Hambantota and Matale districts today (04).

title: Development partners pledge support for Sri Lanka’s relief and recovery efforts
byline: The Ministry of Finance convened a high-level donor forum bringing together diplomatic missions, bilateral and multilateral development partners and international lending agencies to assess the aftermath of Cyclone Ditwah and coordinate assistance for national relief, rescue and restoration efforts.

title: Pakistan sends fresh relief cargo and Elite Rescue Team to Sri Lanka
byline: A Pakistan Air Force C-130 aircraft carrying relief cargo and an elite search and rescue team arrived in Sri Lanka last evening. The consignment was formally received by Deputy Minister Janitha Ruwan Kodithuwakku and handed over by the High Commissioner of Pakistan in Colombo.

title: Sri Pada Pilgrimage season begins today
byline: The annual Sri Pada (Adam’s Peak) Pilgrimage season begins today. more..

title: Kandy-Colombo main road reopened for traffic
byline: The Kandy-Colombo main road has been reopened for vehicular traffic, the Road Development Authority (RDA) has announced.

title: 28,500 tri-forces personnel deployed for rescue and relief operations
byline: A total of 28,500 tri-forces personnel have been deployed for rescue operations and to restore normalcy to public life, the Commander of the Army, Lieutenant General Lasantha Rodrigo has announced.

title: ADB approves US$100 million loan to advance Sri Lanka’s power sector reforms
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) on Wednesday announced a $100 million policy-based loan to further support Sri Lanka’s push to strengthen and modernize its power sector.

title: Two hacked to death in Norochcholai
byline: Two individuals have been hacked to death by a youth in Norochcholai, police stated.

title: Sri Lanka receives USD 1 million donation and emergency relief aid from China
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has received a donation of USD 1 million in financial assistance and emergency relief supplies worth RMB 10 million from the Government of China, the Chinese Embassy in Colombo announced.

title: Authorities reopen Pahala Kadugannawa section of Kandy-Colombo road
byline: The Kandy-Colombo main road has been temporarily closed from the Pahala Kadugannawa area once again, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Australia pledges additional $2.5 mln for victims of Cyclone ‘Ditwah’ in Sri Lanka
byline: The Government of Australia has announced an additional $2.5 million for Sri Lanka, increasing Australia’s response to the impacts of Cyclone ‘Ditwah’ to $3.5 million.

title: ADB announces US$ 3 million emergency grant for Sri Lanka
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has approved a US$ 3 million disaster relief grant for Sri Lanka to support ongoing operations across the island in the aftermath of Cyclone Ditwah.

title: CEB worker engaged in restoring electricity in Hettipola dies after being electrocuted
byline: A worker of the Ceylon Electricity Board, who was engaged in restoring the electricity system damaged due to the adverse weather conditions, has died after being electrocuted in Hettipola.

title: Spill gates of Kala Wewa opened; Residents in downstream areas urged to remain vigilant
byline: Authorities have opened two spill gates of the Kala Wewa by four feet each as of 9:00 a.m. today (04).

title: U.S. transfers fourth former Coast Guard Cutter to Sri Lanka Navy
byline: The United States has transferred a former U.S. Coast Guard cutter, the USCGC EX-DECISIVE, to the Sri Lanka Navy during a ceremony held in Baltimore.

title: Sri Lanka to receive swift access to US$ 350 million IMF funding
byline: A representative of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has stated that Sri Lanka is expected to receive swift access to approximately US$ 350 million, the sixth tranche of the Extended Fund Facility, within two weeks.

title: Bad Bunny becomes world’s most-played artist on Spotify in 2025
byline: The streaming giant said that Puerto Rican star Bad Bunny was the world’s most-played artist of 2025, with more than 19.8 billion streams.

title: CHEC Port City Colombo deploys full disaster-response fleet to Central Province
byline: The CHEC Port City Colombo (Pvt) Ltd. has swiftly deployed its full fleet of disaster-response machinery, in response to the urgent need to restore access to communities affected by Cyclone ‘Ditwah.’

title: Uva state officials pledge one day’s salary for reconstruction efforts
byline: State officials attached to the Uva Province have collectively decided to donate their one day’s salary to support reconstruction efforts in the wake of recent disaster damage.

title: Expressway toll waiver suspended
byline: Motorists using expressways will be required to pay the relevant toll once again after the Road Development Authority has announced the removal of the waiver given during the last few days owing to adverse weather conditions.

title: Extensive damage to roads, bridges, rail tracks and tanks due to Cyclone Ditwah, 246 roads restored
byline: Widespread destruction has been reported across multiple sectors in Sri Lanka due to the recent adverse weather conditions, according to the Commissioner-General of Essential Services, B.K. Prabath Chandrakeerthi.

title: Japan sends medical team to disaster-stricken Sri Lanka
byline: Japan’s overseas aid agency has sent a medical team to Sri Lanka to support ongoing rescue and relief efforts.
